snippet: At the end of Dyckman Street in northern Manhattan, examples of selfless service to the community can be found in many forms.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on area of Upper Manhattan, off Dyckman Street near the Hudson River, that has come to depend on stalwart residents to cope with the fallout, like trash and indifference, of a neighborhood in constant flux.
lead_paragraph: At the end of Dyckman Street in northern Manhattan, examples of selfless service to the community can be found in many forms.

headline.seo: Out on a Manhattan Pier, Putting On a Concert for the Birds
headline.main: Out on a Pier, Putting On a Concert for the Birds
headline.print_headline: Out on a Pier, Putting On a Concert for the Birds
